hours_text:
# Visitor Information

Regular museum hours are Thursday to Sunday, 10 am to 4 pm.  
**NOTE THAT WE ARE CLOSED TO THE PUBLIC FROM JANUARY 12 THROUGH FEBRUARY 6, 2026 WHILE WE CHANGE MANY OF OUR EXHIBITIONS. WE REOPEN WITH REGULAR HOURS ON FEBRUARY 7, 2027.**

The Museum Store is open until 4 pm during regular Museum hours. Shopping is available [online](https://fammuseumstore.shopsettings.com/) 24/7 (except during exhibition changeover periods.) Note that you can still purchase memberships and tickets for the opening reception scheduled for February 6, 2026. on our shopsite. The store will reopen for all purchases on February 7, 2026.

Adults (ages 18 and up): $10  
Youth (5-17): $7   
Children 4 and under: Free 

**Free for Members**  
**[CLICK HERE TO JOIN!](https://fresnoartmuseum.org/support/membership/join-or-renew-now/ "Join or Renew Now!")**

Free admission on the first and third Sunday of the month December 2025 through June 2026. Free days supported by Measure P.

[CLICK HERE TO BUY ADMISSION TICKETS](https://fammuseumstore.shopsettings.com/Admissions-c65825313)

U.S. Military Veterans and Active Duty Military admitted free with ID.

Free parking is available in City-owned lots in front and back of the Museum and on side streets. 

**Hand sanitizer is available throughout the Museum.**

**No reservation is needed!** Call 559.441.4221 for additional information.

**See our[Home Page](https://fresnoartmuseum.org/ "HOME") for announcements of Museum closures and special...

accessibility_text:
## Visitor Guidelines & Accessibility

We look forward to your visit to FAM! Our goal is to provide visitors with a safe and pleasant museum experience in an atmosphere that is conducive to viewing art, studying, and relaxing.

To help you have the best experience during your visit, it is suggested you review the following links beforehand:

  * [General Guidelines](https://fresnoartmuseum.org/visit/visitor-guidelines-and-accessibility/general-guidelines)
  * [Accessibility](https://fresnoartmuseum.org/visit/visitor-guidelines-and-accessibility/accessibility)
collections_text:
#### Welcome to the Fresno Art Museum

## The Fresno Art Museum is Fresno's nationally-recognized fine art museum.

Best known for exhibiting modern and contemporary art from California, art by women artists, and works of art on paper, along with exhibitions that reflect the visual arts traditions of the ethnic groups that contribute to the rich diversity of the San Joaquin Valley.

The Fresno Art Museum's permanent collection consists of over 3,800 paintings, prints, and sculptures by important local, regional, national, and international artists.

It includes a superlative collection of **_Art of the Ancient Americas_** which spans more than 2,500 years of the major artistic traditions of cultures in West Mexico, the Yucatan Peninsula, and the Peruvian Andes.

Founded in 1949, the Fresno Art Museum has been located at First Street and Clinton Avenue in Radio Park since 1960.
